name: Plain Dosa
history: Plain Dosa is a staple in South Indian cuisine with a history dating back centuries. It's a type of fermented crepe made from rice and lentils. Originally from Tamil Nadu, dosa is now popular all over India and in other countries as well.
description: Plain Dosa is a thin, crispy, and savory crepe made from a fermented batter of rice and lentils. It is a versatile dish typically served with chutney and sambar. Plain Dosa is appreciated for its light texture and subtle flavor.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Ensure the dosa batter is well fermented and at room temperature.

instructions.title: Heat the Griddle
instructions.description: Heat a griddle or non-stick pan on medium heat. If using an iron griddle, sprinkle a few drops of water to check if it's hot enough (it should sizzle).

instructions.title: Pour and Spread the Batter
instructions.description: Pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the griddle. Quickly spread it outwards in a circular motion to make a thin crepe.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosa
instructions.description: Drizzle a little oil around the edges of the dosa. Cook until the bottom is golden brown and crispy.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fold the dosa and remove it from the griddle. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

tips: The consistency of the batter is key to making good dosas; it should be smooth and pourable.
Maintain medium heat to ensure the dosa cooks evenly and becomes crispy.
variations: For a healthier version, use a non-stick pan with minimal oil.
Experiment with different types of chutneys or sambar as accompaniments.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Dosa batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store unused batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a griddle or pan until crispy.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic South Indian experience.
Arrange the dosa on a plate with the accompaniments on the side for a pleasing presentation.
